receivedPermissions.description: one of the signers of the KromaSecurityCouncil.

entries.name: L2OutputOracle
entries.description: The L2OutputOracle contract contains a list of proposed state roots which Proposers assert to be a result of block execution. Anyone can participate as a Proposer by depositing in the ValidatorPool. A root can be proposed every 1800 blocks (2s block time).

COLOSSEUM.description: Contract used to challenge state roots and prove fraud.

entries.name: L1Timelock
entries.description: A standard timelock with access control. The current minimum delay is 0s.

issuedPermissions.description: cancel queued transactions.
execute transactions that are ready.
manage all access control roles and change the minimum delay.
manage all access control roles and change the minimum delay.
propose transactions.

directlyReceivedPermissions.description: manage all access control roles and change the minimum delay.
it can update the preconfer address, the batch submitter (Sequencer) address and the gas configuration of the system.

entries.name: ValidatorManager
entries.description: Manages the set of Proposers (Validators in Kroma) and selects the next proposer with the window to submit the output root within 30m, after which anyone can propose for them. It is also the entry point for other contracts, such as the L2OutputOracle and the Colosseum, which distribute output rewards and slash challenge losers. It makes successive calls to the AssetManager to apply changes to the proposers' assets.

receivedPermissions.description: one of the signers of the KromaSecurityCouncil.

entries.name: KromaPortal
entries.description: This is a fork of the standard OP stack OptimismPortal contract, the main entry point to deposit funds from L1 to L2. It also allows to prove and finalize withdrawals.

entries.name: ZKMerkleTrie
entries.description: Merkle Trie contract used to prove withdrawals that were initiated in the legacy system, deprecated for new withdrawals and succeeded by a merkle tree library in the KromaPortal.

entries.name: SystemConfig
entries.description: Contains configuration parameters such as the Sequencer address, gas limit on this chain and the unsafe block signer address.

issuedPermissions.description: it can update the preconfer address, the batch submitter (Sequencer) address and the gas configuration of the system.

gasLimit.description: Gas limit for blocks on L2.

receivedPermissions.description: one of the signers of the KromaSecurityCouncil.
one of the signers of the KromaSecurityCouncil.

entries.name: SP1VerifierGateway
entries.description: This contract is the router for zk proof verification. It stores the mapping between identifiers and the address of onchain verifier contracts, routing each identifier to the corresponding verifier contract.

issuedPermissions.description: holds the power to affect the liveness and safety of the gateway - can transfer ownership, add and freeze verifier routes.

oldVerifier.description: The verifier contract address for SP1, and whether it is frozen (true if frozen). This verifier route was frozen on 2024-09-04.

oldVerifier2.description: The verifier contract address for SP1, and whether it is frozen (true if frozen). This prover route was frozen on 2024-09-21.

oldVerifier3.description: The verifier contract address for SP1, and whether it is frozen (true if frozen). This prover route was frozen on 2024-11-01.

oldVerifier4.description: The verifier contract address for SP1, and whether it is frozen (true if frozen). This prover route was frozen on 2024-11-08.

oldVerifier5.description: The prover contract address for SP1, and whether it is frozen (true if frozen). This prover route was frozen on 2025-01-15.

verifier.description: The prover contract address for SP1, and whether it is frozen (true if frozen).

entries.name: KromaSecurityCouncil
entries.description: Custom Multisig contract in which each signer is identified by a token. The threshold is 8 and the token contract is called SecurityCouncilToken.

receivedPermissions.description: dismiss ongoing challenges and override state roots (`forceDeleteOutput()`).
become a validator without posting a bond.

COLOSSEUM.description: Contract used to challenge state roots and prove fraud.

transactionCount.description: Increases with each Security Council action.

references.text: Security Council members - Announcing Kroma Security Council

receivedPermissions.description: one of the signers of the KromaSecurityCouncil.

entries.name: L1CrossDomainMessenger
entries.description: Sends messages from host chain to this chain, and relays messages back onto host chain. In the event that a message sent from host chain to this chain is rejected for exceeding this chain's epoch gas limit, it can be resubmitted via this contract's replay function.

entries.name: L1ERC721Bridge
entries.description: Used to bridge ERC-721 tokens from host chain to this chain.

receivedPermissions.description: one of the signers of the KromaSecurityCouncil.

directlyReceivedPermissions.description: upgrading the bridge implementation can give access to all funds escrowed therein.

receivedPermissions.description: one of the signers of the KromaSecurityCouncil.

entries.name: ZkVerifier
entries.description: ZK verifier used to verify the last step of a legacy zkEVM proof, which corresponds to a block.

entries.name: Colosseum
entries.description: Contract used to challenge state roots and prove fraud. If successful, the wrong state root in the 0x180c77aE51a9c505a43A2C7D81f8CE70cacb93A6 is replaced.

issuedPermissions.description: dismiss ongoing challenges and override state roots (`forceDeleteOutput()`).

challengedRoots.description: State roots that have been challenged by the validators. Challenges are created when, according to the validators, the roots commit to an incorrect L2 state.

receivedPermissions.description: one of the signers of the KromaSecurityCouncil.

entries.name: L1StandardBridge
entries.description: The main entry point to deposit ERC20 tokens from host chain to this chain.

issuedPermissions.description: upgrading the bridge implementation can give access to all funds escrowed therein.

receivedPermissions.description: one of the signers of the KromaSecurityCouncil.

entries.name: AssetManager
entries.description: Manages the delegation and undelegation of KRO tokens and Kroma Guardian House (KGH) NFTs for Proposers (Kroma Validators) and distributes rewards.

entries.name: UpgradeGovernor
entries.description: A governance proxy contract using token voting with 0xe4D08346609055c091D3DEECdAAd3Bf83119B08c as identification of actors allowed to vote/sign a proposal which is passed to the 0x22605A12cB77Fe420B0cC1263cEb58a77352FDc1 afterwards.

directlyReceivedPermissions.description: manage all access control roles and change the minimum delay.

receivedPermissions.description: holds the power to affect the liveness and safety of the gateway - can transfer ownership, add and freeze verifier routes.

entries.name: SecurityCouncilTokenOwners
entries.description: A soulbound token implementation to identify participants of the KromaSecurityCouncil. Owners of the token are members of the council. There are currently 10 members.

issuedPermissions.description: one of the signers of the KromaSecurityCouncil.

upgrading the bridge implementation can give access to all funds escrowed therein.

entries.name: KromaRewardVaultMultisig
entries.description: Escrows a pool of KRO used as validator rewards by the AssetManager.

receivedPermissions.description: one of the signers of the KromaSecurityCouncil.

entries.name: Poseidon2
entries.description: Contract used to compute hashes. It is used by the ZKMerkeTrie. The contract has been generated using the circomlibjs library.

entries.name: ValidatorPool
entries.description: Contract used to manage the Proposers. Anyone can submit a deposit and bond to a state root, or create a challenge. It also manages the Proposer rotation for each submittable block using a random selection. If the selected proposer fails to publish a root within 30m then the submission becomes open to everyone.

issuedPermissions.description: become a validator without posting a bond.
